channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump says the first phase of an agreement has been reached to end the war in Gaza
item.description: President Trump announced that an agreement has been reached to end the war in Gaza — hours after his Secretary of State handed him a note during a White House event. He may travel to Egypt soon.
item.content:encoded: President Trump announced that an agreement has been reached to end the war in Gaza — hours after his Secretary of State handed him a note during a White House event. He may travel to Egypt soon.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Trump sent federal agents to Albuquerque in his first term. Here's what happened
item.description: One city that saw a surge of federal resources to crack down on crime is Albuquerque. The city is now taking a novel approach to dealing with crime without the use of federal resources.
item.content:encoded: One city that saw a surge of federal resources to crack down on crime is Albuquerque. The city is now taking a novel approach to dealing with crime without the use of federal resources.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Germany's auto industry turns to weapons
item.description: The struggling German auto industry turns to making weapons as the government spends billions on defense.
item.content:encoded: The struggling German auto industry turns to making weapons as the government spends billions on defense.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: NPR visits the Lebanon border, where Israel has continued attacks despite ceasefire
item.description: NPR visits villages along the Lebanese-Syrian border where Israel has continued demolitions and attacks despite a ceasefire last year.
item.content:encoded: NPR visits villages along the Lebanese-Syrian border where Israel has continued demolitions and attacks despite a ceasefire last year.
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: Thousands are in danger near Naples as volcano Campi Flegrei wakens
item.description: In Italy, a super volcano outside of Naples is stirring in a way it hasn't for centuries. And hundreds of thousands of people live right by it.
item.content:encoded: In Italy, a super volcano outside of Naples is stirring in a way it hasn't for centuries. And hundreds of thousands of people live right by it.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: Former FBI director Comey pleads not guilty to lying to Congress
item.description: Jim Comey has pleaded not guilty on two felony charges and plans to argue he was improperly targeted by President Trump.
item.content:encoded: Jim Comey has pleaded not guilty on two felony charges and plans to argue he was improperly targeted by President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Hundreds of National Guard Troops have arrived in Illinois
item.description: Military Troops from Texas have started to arrive outside of Chicago as part of the Trump Administration's battle with Chicago over immigration enforcement.
item.content:encoded: Military Troops from Texas have started to arrive outside of Chicago as part of the Trump Administration's battle with Chicago over immigration enforcement.
item.dc:creator: Michael Puente

item.title: After Spain's blackout, critics blamed renewable energy. It's part of a bigger attack
item.description: When millions lost power in Spain and Portugal this spring, some were quick to blame too much solar and wind power. That wasn't the cause, but the misinformation had an impact.
item.content:encoded:
When millions lost power in Spain and Portugal this spring, some were quick to blame too much solar and wind power. That wasn't the cause, but the misinformation had an impact.

(Image credit: Cristina Quicler)
item.dc:creator: Julia Simon

item.title: An American from Gaza reflects on his homeland, two years after he fled it
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Qassem Ali, an American citizen from Gaza. He left Gaza after war broke out two years ago.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Qassem Ali, an American citizen from Gaza. He left Gaza after war broke out two years ago.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: A Hindu nationalist movement celebrates 100 years. Now what?
item.description: A Hindu nationalist group celebrates its centenary amid a remarkable trajectory: Once banned for its association with Gandhi's killer, a former follower now leads India.
item.content:encoded: A Hindu nationalist group celebrates its centenary amid a remarkable trajectory: Once banned for its association with Gandhi's killer, a former follower now leads India.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid
